bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary Oneil. Complaint filed
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington
-vs -
Mrs. Mary A Oneil
Charge of vagrancy being a habitual drunkard. William Gleiss Prosecuting Witness

Complaint filed Jany 9th, 1885. Warrant issued since time to T. J Robinson Marshall of Walla Walla City W.T. for service who returned the same June 9 having the Deft under arrest who was to drunk to have a hearing and the matter was postponed until she could get sobered up June 11th 1885 Defendant brought into court and confessed guilt and plead guilty under the court being notified in the matter by her own confession and in the testimony of T. J. Robinson and William Gleiss who were serving as witnesses that the Deft was a habitual drunk and and it is here now ordered and adjudged by the court the Defendant Mrs Mary Oneil by refused to give a bond in the sum of fifty dollars for good behaior for the term of three months and in default thereof that the the Deft was committed to the County Jail for three months or until such
